items.sentence: I have nothing to do with the accident, and I know nothing.
I don't think that there was anybody who wasn't frustrated.
The accident happened at the intersection near Tom's house.
Could you please talk a bit louder? I can't hear very well.
Because of you, I'm having problems with my blood pressure.
You could tell by the look on Tom's face that he was lying.
Tom is very squeamish and passes out at the sight of blood.
Tom has been really depressed since Mary broke up with him.
I'm pretty sure that Tom is the one that started the rumor.
Tom is going to graduate from junior high school this year.
Tom will be taking Mary somewhere special for her birthday.
Tom was thirteen years old when he started studying French.
Tom was really surprised when Mary told him not to do that.

I don't think you need to tell Tom what you're going to do.
I don't think you need to tell Tom why you don't like Mary.
When Tom heard that Mary had died, he broke down and cried.
Tom's dog was in the driveway, waiting for Tom to get home.
Tom is a handsome man with curly black hair and brown eyes.
We wanted to go for a walk, but it was raining really hard.
